page.title: 01INTRODUCTION: UPPER SID VALE
page.content:
The{River Sid}has its source just outside our area and flows due south through a peaceful and beautiful{ {landscape.}From the river the valley sides slope steeply to a disected {plateau}surface at approximately 230 metres a.s.l.. The valley sides are made up of fertile{Keuper Marls while the hills are capped by {Cretaceous Greensand}which gives a dry hungry soil.
The character of the Upper Sid is overwhelmingly one of rural tranquility. Only one main road (A375) crosses the area and{settlement}is entirely isolated farms and country houses. Nowhere do more than one or two buildings occur together. Our area forms a recognisable{geographical unit with well defined natural boundaries.
